result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brady J Stutz

records.addlTxt:
9:13 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe.  Defendant Brady J Stutz not in court.  Attorney Alexander R. Huppertz in court for Brady J Stutz. Attorney appears by authorization. 
Atty Huppertz does request a new date and updates the court with the status of the matter. 
State does not object.
Hearing scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

2:24 PM Defendant Brady J Stutz not in court.  Attorney Alexander R. Huppertz in court for Brady J Stutz.  Prosecuting attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney appears by authorization. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Atty Huppertz states he requests further discovery in this matter and more time to go over with client. 
State does not object.
Hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Authorization to Appear filed by Atty. Alexander Huppertz

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

08:43 AM Defendant Brady J Stutz in court with attorney Alexander R. Huppertz.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
